reuters.unknown: C G f reute u f BC SHULTZ USSR TRIP FUE

text.title: SHULTZ USSR TRIP FUELS TALK OF EEP WHEAT OFFER
text.author: By Nelson Graves Reuters
text.body: Speculation United States offer subsidized wheat to Soviet Union appears to reached new level intensity run up to Secretary State George Shultz visit later month to Moscow Rumors impending deal coursed through wheat markets since officials two countries held their customary semi annual grain talks February Moscow s decision at time to reenter U S corn market strengthened perception warming farm trade prospects Shultz set to arrive Moscow April Shultz statement two weeks ago he stand way wheat subsidy offer under Export Enhancement Program EEP coupled announcement his visit to Moscow interpreted by many grain trade representatives here as clear signal Reagan administration preparing offer Administration officials out U S Agriculture Department been extremely tight lipped prospects subsidy offer But USDA officials most part abandoned contention proposal dormant suggesting offer while done deal live possibility Prominent U S grain trade representatives many whom asked to be identified continue to maintain offer to subsidize four tonnes wheat imminent Others who one month ago claimed deal possible saying they rule one out Rep Pat Roberts R Kan yesterday went so far as to predict subsidy offer be made within next ten days to two weeks Aides to Roberts he spoken to Republican leaders who been contact administration officials Richard Fritz director international marketing at U S Wheat Associates he confident export enhancement offer be made by middle month Fritz also he thought value bonus end up being close to offer Washington made Peking earlier year when USDA approved subsidies to China around dlrs per tonne on one tonnes wheat Some grain trade representatives say four mln tonne wheat subsidy offer might help stimulate more Soviet purchases U S corn open door to U S sales soybeans As ever one crucial sticking points wheat deal appear to be price summer administration took controversial step offering Soviets subsidized wheat but were embarrassed when Moscow spurned proposal on grounds dlr per tonne subsidy still left U S wheat prices far above world market prices administration s decision to set subsidy level up front instead accepting bids exporters appeared to be means controlling price while attempting to dampen criticism grain trade sources Nonetheless pricing procedure did prevent Shultz saying Soviets were chortling because Washington offering Soviet housewives cheaper grain than available to U S housewives conventional wisdom among grain trade representatives here general warming relations between two countries since summer combined continued hard times U S grain belt favor subsidy offer addition USSR made clear consider buying U S wheat if were priced more competitively However observers forgotten circumstances surrounding administration s announcement wheat subsidy offer summer Up until time announcment congressional industry leaders were led to believe White House decided to expand Export Enhancement Program to include only Soviets but also much broader list countries Instead administration scaled back offer to include only Soviets minute change heart adds measure uncertainty even to predictions those most convinced administration now pass up opportunity to sell four tonnes wheat to Soviet Union

reuters.unknown: C T f reute b f BC COFFEE QUOTAS BEFORE

text.title: ICO QUOTAS BEFORE OCTOBER UNLIKELY DELEGATES
text.body: The restoration coffee export quotas before end current coffee year Oct Sept now seems unlikely given reluctance by International Coffee Organization ICO producers consumers to resume negotiations on interim quota accord producer delegates told reporters Consumers most producers see no point reopening quota dialogue while Brazil s position remains unchanged they Brazil s refusal to accept reduction previous pct share ICO s global export quota effectively torpedoed talks here month aimed at restoring quotas before October delegates noted Disappointment at lack progress on quotas forced coffee futures London New York to new lows today traders here Near May New York fell below one dlr early trading at around cents per pound traders Producer delegates while possibility reimposing quotas before October remained on ICO agenda practice idea effectively been discarded ICO s executive board session here week so far barely touched on quota debate demonstrating general unwillingness to revive talks while chances success still remote producer delegates Some producers no hurry to see quotas restored despite price collapse seen since failure month s negotiations they With Brazil s frost season approaching who wants to negotiate quotas one leading producer delegate Coffee prices normally rise during Brazil s frost season mainly June August as dealers roasters build up stocks as insurance against possible severe frost damage to Brazil s crop Many producers more interested working towards reimposing quotas October based on new system quota allocations valid until International Coffee Agreement expires they Guatemala already proposed other oilds producer group should meet next two months to begin talks on how to allocate quota shares Producers still seem divided on how to overhaul quota distribution system some producer delegates reporting growing support radical reallocation based on principle objective criteria favoured by consumers At month s council session splinter group small producers backed consumer demands new quota shares based on exportable production stocks while Brazil Colombia rest producers favoured leaving quota allocations unchanged except some temporary adjustments delegate one eight more producers now supported their cause delegate unless major producers like Brazil showed readiness to negotiate new quota shares prospects quota accord October also looked bleak U S most other consumers still determined to make reimposition quotas conditional on redistribution quota shares based on objective criteria ICO observers remained sceptical Brazil be prepared to accept quota reduction when ICO council meets September Brazil adopted tough stance banks on external debt negotiations likely to be just as tough on coffee they They Brazil s reluctance to open coffee export registrations might reflect fears provoke another price slide force emergency ICO council session most likely end failure Producers met afternoon to review market situation but only general discussion how further negotiations should proceed producer delegate Producers plan to hold consultations on quotas then may set date formal producer meeting but plans fixed he ICO executive board reconvened at hours local time to hear report consultants on ICO operations board meeting looks set to end today day earlier than scheduled delegates

reuters.unknown: A f reute h f BC YUGOSLAVIA WINS TIME

text.title: YUGOSLAVIA WINS TIME IN PARIS CLUB REFINANCING
text.body: Yugoslavia won breathing space major official creditors through yesterday s Paris Club refinancing agreement but take time to resolve economic crisis economists at western embassies Yugoslav delegation chief Finance Minister Svetozar Rikanovic refinancing agreed dlrs debt falling due between May year May agreement second multi year Yugoslav debt refinancing based on protocol signed May ushered enhanced monitoring Yugoslavia s economy by IMF Western economists who follow Yugoslav financial affairs similar deal probably emerge talks commercial creditors at end month But they refinancings only provide breathing space because Yugoslavia to repay billion dlrs country still struggling to reverse dramatic decline export earnings fallen pct so far year continuing downward spiral past months Yugoslav hard currency debt grown billion dlrs to stand at billion dlrs at end one country s most dire economic problems debt began to snowball s s due to excessive investment rate exceeding growth Gross Social Product necessitating additional foreign borrowing Rising international oil prices s proved to be serious blow to country s balance payments Deputy Prime Minister Milos Milosavljevic month Yugoslavia repaid dlrs principal dlrs interest so far year According to official Yugoslav figures Yugoslavia repaid record billion dlrs capital interest reducing overall indebtedness by dlrs Mikulic trying to rein rampant retail inflation almost pct year through price incomes controls Janez Zemljaric also Deputy Prime Minister recently Yugoslavia expected definite measure understanding major western creditor nations Western economists Yugoslavia way Paris Club creditors but all creditors were satisfied economic performance year They Paris discussions were heated emotional Economic factors were balanced by political realities economist at one main embassies here but added creditors no complaints regarding Yugoslavia s repayment record because so far always repaid debts on time Yugoslavia refinanced debt regularly since December signed deal International Coordinating Committee commercial banks to refinance maturities arising between January end signed bilateral refinancing agreements March year maturities arising January to March following agreement Paris on March Government ministers told Reuters month Yugoslavia made too great effort to repay debts at great cost to economy regretted Mikulic Yugoslavia unlikely to follow Brazil s lead suspend debt repayments but we understanding what country did Western economists however Mikulic s remarks taken those his ministers could be signal some problems were seen ahead refinancing debt repayments Before Paris talks some Yugoslav officials hinted Yugoslavia could start to look to Soviet Bloc financial support if Belgrade failed to secure necessary refinancing western creditors Sources close to western creditors however they did view threat as serious

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC TOSHIBA COULD BE FIRS

text.title: TOSHIBA COULD BE FIRST TO FEEL U K TRADE ANGER
text.author: By Sten Stovall Reuters
text.body: Toshiba Corp TSBA T Japanese electronics group plans to enter Britain s liberalised telecommunications equipment market risks becoming first casualty current war words over trade between Japan U K Government industry sources U K Authorities lost patience Japanese trading practices they seeking ways to retaliate without unleashing damaging trade war Toshiba s timing seems most unfortunate company as comes exactly when we looking someone to punch one official told Reuters Earlier Toshiba Information Systems U K Ltd wanted to enter British business facsimile key telephone market facsimile machine sends printed data over telephone lines while key telephone system used switching calls within business industry sources move by Toshiba comes middle dispute over Japan s refusal to open up telecommunications market to foreign companies Toshiba s timing most extraordinary one official at Department Trade Industry DTI Tomorrow U K Government consider what legal action can possible take to press Japanese reform Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher given notice U K fight Japanese government s attempt to prevent Cable Wireless Plc CAWL L taking significant position new Japanese international telecommunications venture We regard as test case she told Parliament But while U K keen to see some movement on issue by Japan also worried recent anti Japanese rhetoric may cause developments to get out hand officials Japanese officials Tokyo today reiterated Japan no plans to bow to U K U S Pressure to give foreign telecommunications firms bigger role there government competition deregulation markets major political themes unlikely to make final decisions tomorrow on how to act against Japan officials Detailed consideration issue been shelved during Thatcher s official visit to Soviet Union ends today We waiting Prime Minister to decide what to do DTI pass ball to her as soon as she returns tonight DTI official He Toshiba s application be considered by Office Telecommunications OFTEL OFTEL spokeswoman a decision on application take weeks maybe months Asked whether Toshiba s bid fall victim to British retaliation OFTEL spokeswoman Who knows what s going to happen given current situation Toshiba executive who asked to be named told Reuters We do anticipate any special problems Some analysts queried by Reuters questioned basis Britain s strong stand on Cable Wireless bid One company s proposal equivalent to Japanese company wanting to take stake Mercury International subsidiary Cable Wireless only real competitor British Telecommunications Plc BTY L British Corporate Affairs minister Michael Howard leaves Japan on Saturday minister seek clear timetable Japan easier access British institutions to Japanese financial markets reciprocating easy access Japanese securities houses banks to City London Britain threatened to use new Financial Services Act to revoke or deny licences to Japanese brokerage houses if does get satisfaction But British authorities be far happy if forced to use weapon government sources Sir Nicholas Goodison Chairman London Stock Exchange New York yesterday sanctions against Japanese financial institutions operating U K set back London s ambition to become leading centre corporate financing securities trading Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson also warned yesterday negative effects trade war could on British economy Such development could hit U K Exports sharply alter outlook next general election economic recovery be one government s main themes political analysts

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC AUSTRIAN BANKS DIVIDE

text.title: AUSTRIAN BANKS DIVIDED OVER INTEREST RATE CUT
text.body: Calls cut Austrian interest rates grown recent days but bank chiefs divided over issue Karl Vak General Director Zentralsparkasse und Kommerzialbank Wien called today cut up to half percentage point interest rates across board But Hannes Androsch head Creditanstalt Bankverein CABV VI told Reuters he opposed cut because hurt small savers Vak told news conference January s cut lending rates commercial customers all depositors by quarter point been insufficient January cut followed National Bank s lowering discount Lombard rates by half point line similar Bundesbank move Prime lending rate now pct deposit rates vary between pct Yesterday Hellmuth Klauhs head Genossenschaftliche Zentralbank AG rates could fall at least quarter point or even half point if German rates dropped further Vak noted inflation fallen below one pct widening gap between Austrian rates cheaper West German credit along forecasts slow Austrian economic growth year also justified further interest drop he Karl Pale head Girozentrale und Bank der oesterreichischen Sparkassen AG GIRV VI also called lower deposit rates but lending rates should remain unchanged at moment Interest margins were too small particularly when compared other West European countries But Hans Haumer head Erste Oesterreichische Spar Casse Bank told Reuters no cut should be made unless West German rates came down first Banking sources no bank seemed ready to lower rates alone supporters cut difficulty overcoming opposition Creditanstalt Austria s biggest bank

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC CURRENCY INTERVENTIO

text.title: CURRENCY INTERVENTION TIMING CRUCIAL ANALYSTS
text.body: The dollar s recent decline despite massive central bank purchases forceful reminder official intervention foreign exchanges can work only if well timed to coincide shifts market fundamentals or sentiment dealers analysts Central banks may succeed slowing trend but without accompanying policy changes they stand little chance reversing direction ever growing global market more than billion dlrs traded every day sources Timing psychology key to successful intervention Jim O Neill financial markets economist Marine Midland Banks Inc importance complementary changes economic fundamentals underlined yesterday when change interest rates boosted dollar instantly achieving what central banks tried vain to do week through open market intervention After Citibank raised prime rate by quarter point to pct first change rate since August dollar started to advance reached high Tokyo yen up two yen Tuesday s New York low By contrast monetary authorities spearheaded by Bank Japan estimated to bought as much as billion dlrs days March but could prevent dollar skidding through yen plumbing year low Monday yen Some experts worry central banks lost more than just temporary battle to prop up dollar market wary being caught wrong footed by central bank foray but no longer mesmerized They ve lost their credibility market feels can take on central banks win Michael Snow head treasury operations at Union Bank Switzerland New York relative failure recent intervention stands sharp contrast to success central banks scored when they joined forces to drive dollar down following September Plaza accord Then however central banks easy time because markets Treasuries major industrial powers were agreed dollar needed to head lower to redress massive worldwide trade imbalances Now there no such consensus market saying dollar must fall further because U S trade deficit showing little sign improvement while Japan resisting bid to protect export industries part United States apparently content to let dollar fall gradually further paying little more than lip service to February Paris agreement Group Five plus Canada to foster stability dealers say Specifically they Fed s dollar buying intervention been half hearted designed more as political gesture to Japan than to strike fear into markets It s been pro forma intervention Francoise Soares Kemp chief corporate trader at Credit Lyonnais Because discord market s momentum lower dollar analysts intervention looks doomed to fail It s going to take lot more than central banks to hold dollar at these levels Snow who predicts another to pct depreciation There to be structural changes occur to make market stop selling dollars added Buying six billion dollars three weeks going to do Late decade during presidency Jimmy Carter when dollar under heavy speculative attack central banks sometimes intervened to tune six billion dlrs single day but still failed to stop dollar falling to record low marks analysts Snow purchases on scale now unlikely I don t think anybody stomach because they saw futility seventies Indeed because market grown leaps bound since then intervention on even greater scale probably be needed to impress market Trading volume London New York Tokyo alone year averaged nearly billion dlrs day according to joint central bank study double previous estimate made just two years earlier by Group Thirty private research group There signs central banks too realize futility swimming against tide Bank Japan sources told Reuters Tokyo earlier week they believed limits currency market intervention perhaps being reached other methods bolstering dollar such as invoking currency swap agreements other central banks being considered In era financial liberalization s almost impossible to control flow capital out Japan one senior official Tokyo

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f AM SANCTIONS

text.title: TALKS WILL NOT DELAY TRADE CURBS AGAINST JAPAN
text.author: By Robert Trautman Reuters
text.body: President Reagan s move to impose stiff tariffs on Japanese goods stems deep U S frustration over Japan s trade policy he no intention calling off sanctions trade analysts U S officials put down any idea delaying imposing dlrs tariffs despite seemingly contradictory comments by some Administration aides they add visit here next week by Japanese trade officials visit to Tokyo by senior State Department official likely do nothing to change U S minds Do expect problem to be resolved or sanctions to go into effect senior U S trade official Reagan Friday announced on April he raise tariffs on certain Japanese exports to penalize Japan breaking pact governing trade semiconductors United States says Japanese lived up to their pledge to stop dumping semiconductors third country markets at less than production costs or to open their home market to U S semiconductors Semiconductors tiny silicon memory chips integral components modern electronic goods ranging television sets personal computers to guidance systems on aircraft Some U S officials hinted United States Japan might come to terms on their semiconductor dispute time to cancel planned tariffs but now been dismissed by other senior officials They noted negotiations over compliance pact been going on several months little success Japanese firms week announced plans to cut chip output increase U S chip imports but U S officials Japan s move too late to stave off American tariffs tariffs to be imposed after period public comment but Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige other officials neither comment period or U S Japanese trade talks serve to delay tariffs Baldrige predicted dispute be resolved but I m sure sanctions go before we work out White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater while he hoped something could be done to hold off sanctions it probably likely U S Trade Represenative Clayton Yeutter predicted Japan be able to comply pact time to hold off new tariffs on goods including personal computers television sets power tools electric motors Trade analysts any case U S Japanese semiconductor dispute only one many trade frictions continue until Japan ended policy predatory pricing opened home market to foreign goods Other disputes include Japanese prevention U S firms taking part building new eight billion dlr airport near Osaka selling wide variety goods Japan including many agriculture products new trade row now arisen over Japanese decision to limit foreign participation telecommunication market U S officials American telecommunications market open to foreign firms only fair trade to open Japanese market to per cent foreign participation as Japan previously agreed Britain also protested Japanese limitations American Japanese negotiators meeting to try to resolve issue officials but there no sign any early settlement

text.title: CONRAC CAX EXPLORING RESTRUCTURING BUYOUT
text.body: Conrac Corp whose board rejected dlr share tender offer Mark IV Industries Inc IV exploring alternatives such as restructuring leveraged buyout or takeover company filing Securities Exchange Commission Conrac board directors authorized financial legal advisors to explore several alternatives to Mark IV offer considers inadequate alternatives being explored include restructuring leveraged buyout or takeover company by another company Conrac Conrac board discussed alternatives at special meetings on March decision on whether to adopt any alternatives hinge on the future actions Mark IV unsolicitied tender offer Putting into effect any alternatives being explored could hurt or defeat Mark IV offer Board members were also instructed to keep confidential terms any transaction might be entered into until becomes final company board also took other defensive steps including granting severance agreements to some officers At board meeting yesterday Concac s directors deleted provision allowing holder at least one third all classes voting stock to call special shareholders meeting deleted another provision allowing shareholders to remove directors without cause company defensive moves were taken because Mark IV planned to elect majority designees as directors at special holders meeting if succeeded acquring majority company s common stock offer Conrac Conrac s president vice president treasurer were given severance agreements or golden parachutes Under agreements Conrac President Paul Graf get cash payment twice his annual salary dlrs year if there were change control company including acquisition pct or more company s voting stock Conrac Treasurer Joseph Smorada Vice President Joseph O Donnell who made dlrs year get one and a half times his salary if there were change control Smorada s salary listed SEC filing executives also get cash settlements options plans continuation insurance other benefits

text.title: U S FARM REORGANIZATIONS PROVING COSTLY GAO
text.body: U S farmers who reorganize their operations to circumvent cap on federal payments could add billion dlrs to cost government s agricultural programs by General Accounting Office GAO We estimate should trend farm reorganizations continue reorganizations since could be adding almost dlrs annually to program costs by GAO Senior Associate Director Brian Crowley Cumulative costs six year period to could approach billion dlrs he Between reorganizations added almost new persons to U S Agriculture Department payment rolls Crowley told House Agriculture Subcommittee on Wheat Soybeans Feedgrains GAO at least part recent proliferation reorganizations attributable to farmers efforts to avoid payment limits although exactly how many subdivisions were prompted by concern were impossible to determine Crowley two areas primary concern were formation corporations renting farmland cash by individuals partnerships or joint ventures large number participants Subcommittee Chairman Dan Glickman D Kan evidence few bad apples were using imaginative techniques to skirt payment limit jeopardized political credibility U S farm programs Without elaborating Glickman committee consider legislation to ensure than no one tarnishing good name political support popular support American agriculture so richly deserves To improve effectiveness payment caps Congress could require payments made to corporations limited partnerships or trusts be attributed to individual payment limitation persons who shareholders members or beneficiaries those entities Crowley Attribution could be made at some specified level ownership interest such as five or ten pct Crowley Currently such entities qualify individual dlr payment as long as no stockholder owns or controls more than pct stock Crowley also suggested payments could be restricted to persons actively engaged farming some manner other than just supplying financing Reagan administration proposed similar changes legislation sent to Congress month Crowley GAO investigation uncovered problems USDA s administration payment limitation contributed to the creation new persons through reorganization questionable validity Specifically USDA county offices inconsistently applied regulation requiring reorganization to involve substantive change farming operation order any new persons to qualify payments addition GAO found USDA officials California were incorrectly interpreting regulations relating to financing general partnership operations Crowley also reported U S counties having pct all foreign owned cropland all major crops total farm payments to foreign owners were dlrs However payments represented only pct all payments made counties he

reuters.unknown: E F f reute h f BC AUSTRALIA STOCK EXCHA

text.title: AUSTRALIA STOCK EXCHANGES ENTER NEW ERA
text.author: By Peter Bale Reuters
text.body: The Australian Stock Exchange Ltd ASX today took up responsibility administering new coordinated market made up Australia s six former exchanges now operating as subsidiary trading floors At same time rules prohibiting corporations non stock exchange members holding more than pct Australia s brokerage firms were abolished leaving brokers exposed to greater deregulation Industry sources moves smooth changeover to screen based trading give equities market one voice Westpac Banking Corp WSTP S one first to take advantage changes by announcing today double stake Sydney firm Ord Minnett Ltd to pct Brokers been introduced to creeping deregulation over past three years after legislation passed to end restrictive trade practices forced traditional partnerships to open themselves at first to partial ownership by outside institutions eventually to full ownership phase in period ended several major banks offshore financial institutions investigating taking larger stakes Australian broking houses industry sources Though deregulation all but forced on brokers most now acknowledge influx capital contacts non member shareholders benefited industry they Deregulation brought infusion additional capital broader base products ASX chairman Ian Roach told Reuters Roach fears major bank shareholders impose restrictive conservative bank culture on dynamic sharebroking industry were unfounded So far banks been mindful importance preserving entrepreneurial aspect sharebroking he But some brokers others sceptical expect expiration golden handcuff pacts tied partners to their firms period after incorporation could cause massive talent drain Several leading brokers already announced plans to leave their firms establish new private client businesses while others plan public floats While bank shareholders enjoyed dabbling broking during Australia s record two and a half year bull run they could find themselves without expertise they need during more difficult times some brokers Rene Rivkin head Sydney brokerage house Rivkin James Capel Ltd many brokers resist anything restricts their individuality entrepreneurial spirit could leave new entrants into business short staffed If I were bank I m sure I gone into broking What s going to happen when lot these golden handcuffs come to end Rivkin Only then banks know what they ve got he Rivkin s firm pct owned by Hongkong Shanghai Banking Corp HKBH HK unit Wardley Australia Ltd plans public float between pct My relationship Hong Kong bank wonderful They leave me alone give me all support I need Maybe if we weren t doing so well there wouldn t be support but hasn t happened he Other firms might be so lucky he they could find difficult to preserve their independence when bull market ends two years value Australian sharemarket leapt pct turnover value up pct to billion dlrs year to June growth put existing trading systems clearing houses under pressure unification six sovereign exchanges should accelerate development screen based trading single clearing house industry sources July year leading stocks be traded pilot ASX s screen trading system depending on reception by brokers expected to replace trading floors over next four years industry sources

text.title: U S JAPAN TALKS SEEN NO DELAY TO TARIFFS
text.author: By Robert Trautman Reuters
text.body: President Reagan s move to impose stiff tariffs on Japanese goods stems deep U S frustration over Japan s trade policy he no intention calling off sanctions trade analysts U S officials put down any idea delaying imposing dlrs tariffs despite seemingly contradictory comments by some Administration aides visit here next week by Japanese trade officials visit to Tokyo by senior State Department official likely do nothing to change U S decision they added Do expect problem to be resolved or sanctions to go into effect senior U S trade official Reagan Friday announced on April he raise tariffs on certain Japanese exports to penalize Japan breaking pact governing trade semiconductors Some U S officials hinted United States Japan might settle their dispute time to hold off tariffs but now been dismissed by other senior officials They noted negotiations over compliance pact been going on several months little success Japanese firms week announced plans to cut chip output increase U S chip imports but U S officials Japan s move too late to stave off American tariffs tariffs to be imposed after period public comment but Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige any settlement probably come too late to delay tariffs U S Trade Represenative Clayton Yeutter predicted Japan be able to comply pact time to hold off new tariffs on goods including personal computers television sets power tools electric motors Trade analysts any case U S Japanese semiconductor dispute only one many trade frictions continue until Japan ended policy predatory pricing opened home market to foreign goods Other disputes include Japanese prevention U S firms taking part building new eight billion dlr airport near Osaka selling wide variety goods Japan including array agricultural products new row now arisen over Japan s decision to severely limit foreign participation telecommunication market U S officials American telecommunications market open to foreign firms only fair trade to open Japanese market to pct foreign participation as Japan previously agreed Britain also protested Japanese limitations

text.title: TALKING POINT PUROLATOR COURIER PCC
text.author: By Patti Domm Reuters
text.body: Emery Air Freight Corp topped leveraged buyout offer Purolator Courier Corp by dlrs but Wall Street reacting as though another offer may surface Purolator s stock climbed today to over Emery s dlr per share offer Emery topped dlr per share or dlr offer E F Hutton LBO Inc Some analysts latest dlr offer Purolator exceeded their expectations Several analysts previously they saw takeover values package delivery company dlr per share range At least one however estimated company could be taken over range to dlrs per share Analysts today venture to say whether another offer could be made but some arbitragers still held to belief bidding could go higher They no choice to seek out best possible offer Emery shown courage to go forth one arbitrager who speculated other courier companies may also emerge as bidders It makes sense James Parker Robinson Humphrey But It won t make out as well as they think They won t get pct synergies Analysts acquisition could cost Emery earnings short term but long term after eliminating redundancies selling other Purolator assets should boost Emery s profitability Parker combined Purolator Emery rival United Parcel Service as second largest U S package delivery company after Federal Express Corp FDX pct market Parker speculated combined Emery Purolator pct six to seven billion dlr delivery business This make Emery bigger factor light weight delivery business but make them power house Douglas Arthur Kidder Peabody Co Purolator today declined comment on Emery offer chairman Nicholas Brady did return phone call E F Hutton LBO also declined comment on Emery offer but extended expiration withdrawal period on offer to April six at midnight today at midnight EST One analyst speculated extension makes more likely Hutton attempt another offer However he skeptical company outside package delivery industry want to outbid dlrs per share because same synergies as courier company Since Purolator agreed late February to buyout by some management E F Hutton Group EFH subsidiary speculation arisen more bidding to come buyout surrounded by controversy since Purolator board member Doresy Gardner resigned March Gardner he believed better offer could be made by another entity spokesman Gardner today former director no contact Emery nor did he any other buyers lined up Purolator Purolator s deal Hutton also called into question by shareholder suit filed earlier week attempted to stop tender offer to allow another bidder to come forth Hearings New York state court were delayed until Monday Arbitragers they believed Hutton offer could be bettered because Wall Street firm planning to keep cash tied up Purolator Hutton providing dlr bridge loan later be replaced other debt Hutton maintain majority interest Purolator Hutton sources firm fact facing risk n investment since did know when could reclaim dlr loan Emery year lost dlrs on revenues dlrs Purolator lost dlrs on dlrs revenues

text.body: New York coffee futures prices probably fall to cents lb next month before consolidation trend sets according to market analysts Yesterday prices spot May contract fell below dlr lb first time since August after International Coffee Organization did place new export quota discussions on current agenda Talks aimed at renegotiating ICO export quotas after five years price supporting agreements broke down February Short term looks like definite test cents perhaps cents William O Neill coffee analyst Elders Futures But additional downside may be all great current levels At price level market very vulnerable to bullish developments O Neill added Rather than us having market plummet we ll kind see prices erode probably to around cents I definitely see cents rule out brief drop to cents Debra Tropp coffee analyst Prudential Bache But she by June worries freeze Brazil growing areas become more market factor prices likely to consolidate ahead time trader at major international trade house who asked to be named he expects cent drop near term but believes if Brazil opens May registrations at relatively high export price requires high contribution quota exporters market could steady at lower levels Longer term he added producer pressure mount on Brazil to agree to consumers export quota terms new international agreement could come into force next fall Since February talks broke down market fallen cents lb to low cents lb today as buyers sellers sought to reassess supply demand Generally analysts say producers large buildup stocks but U S roasters drawn down supplies need to do some buying soon Most producing nations just completed or to complete their annual harvests exportable supplies at their seasonal peak Exports remain behind year ago warehouses producer nations becoming increasingly overburdened Sandra Kaul coffee analyst Shearson Lehman firm s forthcoming quarterly coffee report Kaul producers need to procure hard currency to service foreign debt put further pressure on them to sell this should keep substantial pressure on exporters to undertake sales despite drop prices to six year lows Kaul believes market drop to cents lb before Brazil s frost season begins June Accurate assessments roaster demand hard to come by though analysts note peak winter consumption period passed demand usually slows time year Shearson s Kaul estimated U S roaster ending stocks as January including soluble roasted at bags compared at end September small drawdown usually busy winter roasting season But Elders O Neill The roasters overstocked by any means Analysts picking bottom to market difficult given fact prices fallen into uncharted territory below long term support at dlr per lb several traders sidelines might be preferable short term

text.author: by TED D AFFLISIO REUTERS
text.body: Diamond Shamrock executives to reduce vulnerability to takeover pressures they want to raise value two companies to be formed by splitting Diamond Shamrock If we can get price up to value company we be vulnerable to takeover pressure Charles Blackburn Diamond Shamrock s president soon to be chief executive officer new exploration producing company whose name yet been decided He visiting New York talks investors After successfully countering takeover bid launched by T Boone pickens January Diamond Shamrock spinoff refining marketing operation into Diamond Shamrock Refining Marketing Co before April annual meeting Blackburn told Reuters Our advisors told us split give better share value to investors market give better multiples pure refining marketing exploration production plays two companies now process organizing themselves to become pure plays executives Blackburn new company be pure exploration production operation he looking to divest non oil gas operations particularly Diamond Shamrock s coal operations Blackburn we talks coal operations but I cannot discuss further at time He company debt to capital ratio pct could be paid down over time Blackburn company seek to generate further internal savings rationalizing operations personnel reductions He set goal dlrs internal savings we need to get at least dlrs savings Blackburn I rather describe as savings coming eliminating non essential activities as we purify exploration production business There some people associated those activities but more matter cutting trimming rather than wholesale changes Blackburn Blackburn intends to run tight ship dividends initially be paid resultant savings invested into exploration production Our goal to find barrels year U S to replace our production I think we can do at level we intend to spend Blackburn It might be more difficult to find more oil more oil internationally at these levels he added Blackburn his new company spend dlrs North America dlrs overseas mainly Indonesia search oil gas reserves Diamond Shamrock produced barrels day oil pct Indonesia while gas output cubic feet day pct U S Blackburn he believed he could find oil to replace production at low costs were dlrs barrel worldwide dlrs barrel U S Blackburn also company be willing to buy reserves if we can find right producing properties at right price Blackburn estimated oil prices average dlrs barrel year average prices received natural gas at dlrs per thousand cubic feet Blackburn he currently estimates at thee prices products company cash flow dlrs This mean net negative cash flow as we pretty much spend our cash flow to find more oil gas Blackburn company search both oil gas almost exclusively estasblished basins Roger Hemminghaus who be chairman new Diamond Shamrock Refining Marketing Co year sales approximately billion dlrs told Reuters his company taking on some debt We taking on some dlrs new debt three tier financing emphasizing revolving loan some term loans some unsecured private placement now latter stages signing agreement Chemical New York Corp CHL company s lead banker on loan Hemminghaus debt set company off at pct debt to capital ratio Hemminghaus is too much To alleviate we hold our capital expenditures down pay down debt so at end two years ratio be reduced to mid pct range Hemminghhaus cash flow be plus or minus dlrs year earnings depreciation terms major projects Hemminghaus capital expenditures be dlrs to dlrs spread over all company s projects major project be two year upgrading project on McKee reinery Panhandle at bpd rated capacity company also refinery south San Antonio where be headquartered capacity bpd

reuters.unknown: E F f reute r f BC dome talking point

text.title: TALKING POINT DOME PETROLEUM DMP
text.author: By LARRY WELSH Reuters
text.body: Dome Petroleum Ltd s loss billion dlrs believed to be biggest ever by Canadian company little impact on daily operations but pressure creditors to accept proposal to restructure Dome s debt more than billion dlrs industry analysts Essentially what Dome s loss does put more focus on importance restructuring puts more pressure on creditors to agree to debt rescheduling oil analyst who asked he be identified Dome reported earnings yesterday Analysts huge loss improves appeal debt accord by underlining company statements creditors receive little or nothing under forced liquidation could take several years to complete After several months negotiations group major creditors other unsecured public debt holders Dome submitted complex proposal earlier month includes converting debt to equity extending repayment time They ve their talks now they proposal so banks to decide whether to accept restructuring or pull plug analyst He others huge loss including writedowns totalling billion dlrs before dlr reduction deferred income taxes dramatically enforces company s claim pct drop world oil prices crippled financial position But analysts writedown only impacts Dome s balance sheet does hurt company s cash position To large extent these writeoffs carrying value assets really just bookkeepers catching up to what stock market been telling us long time reflecting collapse oil text.body: The U S House Agriculture Committee approved proposals to extend life Export Enhancement Program EEP through fiscal urged Reagan administration offer EEP wheat to Soviet Union proposals were approved as amendments to comprehensive trade bill moving through Congress year addition to amendments on EEP committee approved several proposals could restrict imports lamb casein sugar containing products tobacco Those amendments affecting imports face uncertain future because House Ways Means Committee overall jurisdiction over trade legislation oppose them Congressional sources effect EEP amendments be to extend life program five years through fiscal rather than current three years through fiscal amendments offered by Rep Dan Glickman D Kan also increase funding program to billion dlrs billion now Furthermore committee passed amendment offered by Rep Glickman instructs U S Agriculture Department to value EEP bonus commodities at market value acquisition value Glickman change make program pct less expensive to operate provision on EEP wheat to Soviet Union offered by Rep Bob Smith R Ore does require administration make offer but urges such action committee approved amendment offered by Rep Glenn English D Okla requiring Secretary Agriculture to begin discussions other major grain producing countries aimed at jointly reducing world grain production Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter yesterday opposed amendment saying such commodity agreements do work Among host amendments to restrict imports approved by panel most significant require quotas on imports goods containing more than pct bulk farm product subject to U S quotas amendment offered by Rep Arlan Stangeland R Minn aimed primarily at curbing imports Canada products containing sugar foreign foods containing dairy products also may affect peanut cotton tobacco imports Committee sources Another amendment place quota on U S imports casein dairy product shipped to U S primarily by New Zealand Ireland panel also voted to apply to lamb imports same countercyclical import quota law operating U S beef imports Other miscellaneous amendments included Urging administration consider retaliating against Japan South Korea if those countries do remove restrictions on beef imports Boosting amount U S grain must be shipped each year under food aid program called Section to tonnes tonnes now Requiring Agriculture Secretary conduct study Canadian Wheat Board import licensing system wheat to determine if non tariff trade barrier Requiring Agriculture Secretary reimburse National Corn Growers Association up to dlrs costs defending U S feedgrains program against Canadian countervailing duty case year Urging administration oppose Canadian decision to apply duty on U S corn text.body: Australia risking wheat export sales by providing enough specific quality grades to meet buyer requirements Australian Wheat Board AWB Many AWB customers becoming increasingly quality conscious demanding strict adherence to contractual quality specifications board submission to Royal Commission into Grain Storage Handling Transport Many specifications more specific than current categories used Australia commission trying to identify ways saving costs boosting efficiency grain handling system Australia must rely on quality to retain wheat market share because competitors supplying cheaper but lower quality grades AWB submission stressed need to segregate wheat categories at every stage receival to shipping Better industrial relations at grain terminals more uniform transport systems across states extensive stock control were vital to improved marketing submission also Australia s federal system impeded AWB s role coordinating managing marketing wheat AWB called end to physical legislative constraints at state borders prevent efficient transport grains to other states shipment It essential wheat moves by most economic mode to nearest efficient port irrespective state wheat grown or stored example wheat grown northern New South Wales NSW might move more efficiently to Brisbane Queensland than to Sydney or Newcastle New South Wales Similarly southern NSW wheat might better be shipped to Portland or Geelong Victoria Legislation giving state rail authorities monopoly over grain shipments one notable impediment AWB current approach state based bulk handling authorities essential although favoured authorities maintaining at least their current level control storage transport as long as quality maintained appendix on port loading costs showed cost between U S Dlrs to load tonne vessel at various Australian ports compared dlrs at Houston at Port Cartier Quebec tonner

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC CHINA TAKES SHARE TRA

text.title: CHINA TAKES SHARE TRADING OFF REFORM AGENDA
text.author: By Mark O Neill Reuters
text.body: China opened fifth securities market yesterday Tianjin but share issues share trading no longer on agenda economic reform official newspapers Western diplomats One Western diplomat share issues on backburner because they ideologically too sensitive People s Daily month trading shares not compatible socialist materialist civilisation newly opened market traded bonds four state owned firms buyers outnumbered sellers China Daily China s first securities market since opened August Shenyang followed by markets Shanghai September Peking Harbin year They trade mostly bonds Bonds all right There no risk to holder there no question his having any ownership stake firm diplomat People s Daily article joint stock companies might be way to reform large medium size state firms nor model reforming China s ownership system Share issues make workers owning them think only economic advantage their own firms rather than nation as whole People s Daily As late as December officials were pushing idea share issues as way to channel excess cash economy into production reduce state s investment burden motivate share owning employees to work harder November Liu Hongru deputy governor People s Bank China told delegation New York Stock Exchange long term funds market should be built up with stocks bonds issuance as main form Stocks bonds should be issued through banks trust investment companies transfer securities should be conducted through financial institutions opening up secondary markets should be studied after trials experiments Liu subject share issues trading widely covered official press year usually positive way One most far reaching proposals came Peking university professor He all but essential state firms should become joint stock holding companies state holding controlling share could be as low as pct professor argued separate government administrators managers firms key goal China s reforms He his plan make companies independent units under board directors diplomat dropping share issues may be result conservative backlash since January resignation reformist Communist Party chief Hu Yaobang He share issues raise sensitive questions What happens if value falls People used to may be dissatisfied What happens if person gets very rich through share ownership government does want disparity income One Chinese journalist conditions ripe widespread share issues In China success or failure firm does entirely lie within own hands There many external factors beyond control he To make share purchasing attractive you need secondary market perhaps speculators he But speculation acceptable China Asked if there political reasons putting aside share issues he China economics politics cannot be separated There very major review economic reforms going on There political factors involved journalist If economy runs well year political pressure be less Comments by officials new Tianjin market echoed his caution China Daily quoted one official as saying China does intend to develop stock exchanges equivalent to those West while socialist economic system Given special circumstances our country we must approach new phenomenon contemplative comprehensive way so as to guide trading onto healthy track he

text.title: NAKASONE SAID WILLING TO REVISE SALES TAX PLAN
text.body: Japanese press reports Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone he may compromise on his controversial sales tax plan bowing to widespread opposition even within his own party reports he told meeting supporters his ruling Liberal Democratic Party today proposed five pct tax should be amended if there anything wrong Officials were immediately available comment Until now Nakasone vowed to press on tax as part his plan to reform Japan s year old tax system But most Japanese newspapers news agencies quoted him as saying today he foist tax on Japanese people if they hated Opposition parties some industry groups say tax breaks Nakasone general election campaign promises July discourage consumer spending needed to meet government pledges to try to stimulate economic growth Pressure tax to be amended or shelved likely to increase soon before first round local elections due on April political analysts Resistance spread opposition parties affected industries to LDP Some Japan s provincial governments called plan to be scrapped or handled carefully government officials Some leading LDP candidates local polls asked Nakasone to make campaign speech them as they fear his presence weaken their position elections

pesos made by SMC s Hong Kong subsidiary Neptunia Corp Ltd bid to buy back shares year UCPB peso payment be forfeited because SMC Chairman Andres Soriano III failed to fulfil his commitment to buy shares pesos advanced to UCPB controlled trading companies UCPB rejected original offer pesos per share made by SMC shares grew to after pct stock dividend declared June year spokesman SMC company s member board met today to discuss proposed compromise spokesman declined comment on outcome board meeting saying dispute under arbitration President Corazon Aquino month asked SMC UCPB to set up three man arbitration panel to resolve ownership issue panel due to submit report by April Eduardo de Los Angeles government nominee SMC board filed formal complaint before Securities Exchange Commission week accusing Soriano eight other directors violating fiduciary duty De Los Angeles to opposed decision by SMC s board December to assume peso Neptunia loan

text.body: Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson s remarks yesterday suggesting there precise exchange rate targets pound undermined sterling dashing hopes early cut U K Base rates analysts But market s reaction testing exchange rate levels indicated by Lawson probably overdone longer term outlook sterling remained bullish they agreed apparent break previous policy secrecy Lawson told National Economic Development Council meeting he comfortable sterling exchange rates around current levels specifying rates around marks dlrs Lawson added U K Government intended to keep sterling at present levels using currency intervention interest rates to achieve February Paris agreement Group Five Canada to stabilise exchange rates widely believed to include target ranges but all participants to meeting so far refused to specify these Markets were quick to react to statement chopping one U S Cent over one pfennig off pound to match levels mentioned by Lawson But most analysts polled they did believe Lawson s statement signalled change U K Policy Keith Skeoch chief economist at stockbrokers James Capel Co the remarks been blown out proportion Lawson paying now little bit slip tongue Barclays de Zoete Wedd economist Mark Brett there nothing great fantastic Chancellor s statement He he did believe rates indicated by Chancellor were precise targets but merely represented central rates around sterling be allowed to fluctuate perhaps by as much as pct It be insane to pinpoint exchange rate ahead election I don t believe Lawson mad enough to tie himself to fixed rate Brett Currency markets were keen official statements to clarify scope Paris accord reactivate currency trading mood easily led to over reaction analysts Making similar statements when market high strung ready to bounce perhaps mistake one senior dealer U S Bank Capel s Skeoch it gives foreign exchange markets something to shoot at It obvious government as member Group Six agreed exchange rate bands But they cut stone they can change time Skeoch Brett we think marks level central rate Give or take pfennigs all fine all analysts played down significance remarks however Chris Dunn economist at Royal Bank Canada remarks may signal decisive move to insulate sterling fortunes dollar Although two thirds Britain s trade conducted European countries sterling traditionally shadowed dollar rather than mark analysts noted Britain must decide whether wants to follow U S Or throw lot Europe Dunn It suggests while U K actually applying to join European Monetary System seeking protection by shadowing Bundesbank made clear wants U K To clarify position relative to mark he Analysts sterling s dip on currency markets following Lawson s remarks made early half point cut U K Base rates current pct levels unlikely short term Over next three weeks cut out unless we get some extremely good economic indicators Capel s Skeoch Base rates been cut twice by one half point March after March budget presentation analysts been expecting another half point cut shortly afterwards

text.title: SENATE VOTE ON REAGAN S VETO REMAINS IN DOUBT
text.body: A partisan battle over President Reagan s veto billion dlr highway bill resumes Senate today after apparent victory White House left doubt when key Democrat switched his vote Senate yesterday voted to sustain Reagan s veto by narrow margin but Democrats moved to reconsider vote Terry Sanford North Carolina only Democrat to support Reagan later he decided to vote to override when bill reconsidered If no other votes switch Senate override veto on reconsideration Senate Republican leader Robert Dole Kansas He Reagan Administration officials continue to lobby votes to sustain veto As right now vote be to in favor bill veto be overriden Dole After several hours delay Senate leaders were unable to agree on time second vote Senate recessed until morning issue unresolved Sanford denied he been pressured to change his vote but told Senate I talked to been talked to by number senators I thought little more deeply vote first Senate vote put Reagan on verge political triumph he sought to show he rebounding strongly Iran arms scandal

text.title: TOSHIBA PRODUCES SUPERCONDUCTIVE WIRE
text.author: By James Kynge Reuters
text.body: Officials at Toshiba TSBA T told reporters they developed kind wire can conduct electricity no resistance therefore no loss power Although other firms developed such superconductive materials Toshiba scientists their discovery first allows material to be formed into pliable wire Developing superconducting material works at room temperature no resistance object frenetic worldwide scientific race main applications be super powerful magnets small computers immense power speed electric transmission lines use negligible power electric generators consume no power Toshiba probably be five years before can incorporate superconductors marketable machines But problems still to be surmounted Present superconductors including Toshiba s need to be cooled to very low temperatures before they can pass electricity no resistance requires costly liguid gas coolants Superconductors developed to date transmit only small currents cannot conduct alternating current only direct current government scientists Toshiba spent billion yen on research development year ended March counts itself among leading superconductor research companies Japan manager Toshiba s public relations Yuji Wakayama wires company uses blend yttrium barium copper oxide can conduct no resistance at minus degrees centigrade

text.body: South Africa s largest labour federation issued broad call to country s trade union movement to support thousands striking black railway workers criticised state owned rail company threatening to replace strikers whites Jay Naidoo general secretary Congress South African Trade Unions COSATU claims membership over workers most whom black urged labour unions to show solidarity striking railwaymen adding key issue strike freedom workers to join trade unions their choice Naidoo criticised government run South African Transport Services SATS refusing to recognise South African Railway Harbours Workers Union represents most strikers He also accused SATS applying racist labour policies by threatening to replace strikers added corporation s decision further inflamed dispute strike began on March when workers walked out following railway company s refusal to go to formal arbitration talks over dismissal train driver SATS says some workers involved stoppage but union leaders put number strikers closer to Cosatu official number affiliate unions resolved to take solidarity action inform South Africa s Labour Minister their decision He also urged country s two largest employer groups Association Chambers Commerce Federated Chamber Industries to intervene to resolve strike

text.title: U S URGED TO STRENGTHEN DEBT STRATEGY
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: Several industrial nations pressing United States to consider whether debt strategy under increasing fire developing world needs to be strengthened monetary sources say While few nations ready to pour vast sums money into radical debt relief style solutions to debt crisis pressure building greater International Monetary Fund role plan But U S officials who fighting off demands change by Congress confident they retain support their strategy probably be endorsed communique issued by IMF s policy making Interim Committee One Reagan administration official recent discussion among leading industrial countries showed there very broad strong support continuing strategy official interview I don t sense there s strong desire to revise debt strategy except course here on Capitol Hill But monetary sources some industrial nations like France Italy troubled by signs strategy increasingly strained Britain too to be concerned late Washington called on multilateral development banks like World Bank commercial banks to increase loans to major debtors by billion dlrs over three years return major debtors were expected to undertake reforms promoting inflation free economic growth more open markets reduced government role economy IMF to retain central role strategy shifting economic reform programs emphasizing austerity to stressing growth freer trade policies foreign investment debtor nations But monetary sources some nations want even more flexibility IMF when sets economic programs tied to loans debtor nations Such flexibility include less rigid economic targets often lead to artificial crises when they met more reliance on ranges benchmarks to monitor economic performance There also concern level IMF lending too low commercial banks themselves under attack tawdry loan levels to debtors want to see increased IMF holds semi annual meetings World Bank next week only be small net lender year Much loan disbursements offset by repayments Meanwhile most countries including United States acknowledge banks lived up to their commitments Paul Volcker chairman Federal Reserve Board particularly irritated reluctance commercial banks to lend more to reforming debtors monetary sources say New IMF managing director Michel Camdessus understood to be worried Fund s image developing world where often depicted as source economic ills Camdessus experience as former chairman so called Paris Club western creditor governments given him extensive first hand experience debt crisis Brazil February declared interest paymernts moratorium on billion dlrs commercial bank debt flatly ruled out adopting program IMF sponsored economic reforms Peru too rejected IMF program curbing debt repayments to pct exports But administration official Brazil s strategy using moratorium as negotiating tool might backfire It s probably turning out to be more complicated than they thought underlines extreme risk debtor country takes on itself when begins down road official Indeed U S banks laying groundwork writing down their Brazilian loans U S officials generally praised most debtors adopting genuine economic reforms multilateral institutions stepping up their lending they point out Venezuela Chile Philippines struck agreement commercial banks stretching out debt repayments But problems still dog assembly billion dlrs bank loan Mexico many officials acknowledge may be major cash loan debtor country Instead banks being pressed to come up more novel ways easing liquidity squeeze debtor nations prospect greater official involvement debt strategy depends chiefly on ability western nations to come up more finance While there sympathy Congress various forms debt relief more U S funds World Bank or IMF virtual impossibility today s era budget restraint leaves rich surplus nations like Japan West Germany but neither country favors generalized debt relief Reagan administration inclined to bow to Congressional pressure changes regulations governing foreign loans to make easier banks to account delays interest principal repayments

text.title: EYSKENS SAYS US PRIME RISES WILL AID CURRENCIES
text.author: By Tony Carritt
text.body: Belgian Finance Minister Mark Eyskens warmly welcomed week s increase U S Prime rates calling move went beyond Group Five Canada Paris accord on stabilising currencies rate rise underpin economic financial policy convergence among major countries he added interview Reuters Eyskens also made clear he believed countries involved accord U S Japan West Germany France Britain Canada agreed tentative fluctuation ranges exchange rates Eyskens speaking before hosting informal meeting European Community finance ministers central bank chiefs Belgium weekend focusing on international monetary situation proposals strengthening European Monetary System EMS Asked dollar s recent fall on currency markets Eyskens he believed Paris agreement proving more or less workable despite what he called evident disagreements over U S Economic monetary policy between Treasury Secretary James Baker Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker Besides Baker s public statements dramatically influenced exchange markets trade tensions between U S And Japan also caused dollar s fall expecially against yen he But he expressed optimism Washington Tokyo could reach compromise their row over semi conductor trade I think agreement quite possible he Eyskens he very agreeably surprised by week s quarter point increase U S Prime rates despite obvious negative consequences debtor countries It positive element goes further than Paris Louvre agreement It market taking account content he He added coordination interest rates fundamental element economic monetary convergence between leading industrialised economies A policy maintaining exchange rates within fluctuation ranges possible if accompanied at least by more coordinated policy interest rates he Eyskens made clear he believed G countries agreed Paris on ranges to hold their currencies He end February Louvre accord partners agreed to cooperate closely to foster exchange rate stability around current levels clearly alluded to system tentative fluctuation margins He added meeting statement been meaningless if G discussed technicalities implementing Eyskens there growing economic convergence among leading industrialised countries pointing towards greater order international monetary system That doesn t mean we ready to restore Bretton Woods the post World War Two system fixed exchange rates but within International Monetary Fund Interim Committee we thinking terms target zones fluctuation ranges to be implemented defended he Interim Committee meets next week Washington ahead IMF s Spring meetings Eyskens EC ministers prepare gatherings at weekend s talks He he hoped wide ranging talks on future EMS at weekend meeting based on proposals EC s Monetary Committee Committee Central Bank Governors strengthening system through technical institutional changes Eyskens he expected EC Commission President Jacques Delors to submit proposals fully liberalising capital movements within nation bloc made clear he shared Delors view must be accompanied by reinforcement EMS Both totally linked Liberalisation without strengthening EMS destabilise Community he

text.title: NIGERIAN NAIRA FIRMS AFTER RULE CHANGE
text.body: The Nigerian naira firmed against dollar banking sources after rules governing foreign exchange auctions at central bank were changed marginal rate set at today s auction reporters were barred first time since sessions began September to dollar compared at session on March sources Under new system unveiled on March operation first time today bidding banks must pay foreign exchange at rate they bid rather than as previously at rate lowest successful bid measure aimed at discouraging banks bidding high thus driving down naira s value But banking sources other analysts demand foreign exchange remained sharply higher than available funds Henceforth sessions be held every fortnight instead weekly today only dlrs on offer compared dlrs usually on sale each week rule change appeared to immediate impact on bids Today s highest bid to dollar compared top bid two weeks ago Banks who bid higher than marginal rate be able to pass on their rate to their customers while marginal rate only act as marker transactions

reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC COFFEE PRICES SET TO

text.title: COFFEE PRICES SET TO CONTINUE SLIDE TRADERS
text.author: By Martin Hayes and Jane Merriman Reuters
text.body: Coffee prices look set to continue sliding near term given lack progress towards new International Coffee Organization ICO export quota accord according to coffee traders analysts Robusta coffee futures dipped sharply to year lows yesterday at stg per tonne basis May position when lack new debate on quotas at ICO talks here confirmed expectations efforts to restore quotas be revived at stage they day ICO average composite price fell to cents lb April lowest years Quotas now be renegotiated before ICO s annual September council session interim Brazilian frost season June to August may prove only bullish factor to stem further price weakness they Futures bounced back lows today towards previous trading range around stg per tonne on May as market recovered yesterday s confidence reuters.unknown: A F RM f reute r f BC BANK MONTREAL REASONA

text.title: BANK MONTREAL REASONABLY OPTIMISTIC ON BRAZIL
text.body: Bank Montreal BMO M Chairman William Mulholland he reasonably optimistic debt negotiations between Brazil commercial bank creditors can be accomplished satisfactorily long run It s going to be bit rocky short term couple months but I am reasonably optimistic longer term he told press briefing here Earlier Mulholland announced Bank Montreal formally applied to swap up to dlrs roughly one billion dlr cross border exposure to Brazil into local equity investments under novel conversion scheme Tensions been running high between Brazil bank creditors since President Jose Sarney imposed unilateral suspension interest payments on some billion dlrs commercial bank debt on February bankers Only yesterday three leading U S banks voluntarily put their Brazilian loans on non accrual status took hefty cut net income first quarter ended March Bankers saw as clear refusal to be intimidated into granting major concessions as forthcoming refinancing talks Bank Montreal s Mulholland regretted Brazil s action but declined to discuss what action his bank might take Mulholland merely Bank Montreal canceled any short term credit lines came up renewal on March However John Bradlow senior vice president corporate goverment banking division possible Bank Montreal might follow U S banks lead second quarter results accounting A decision be made at April or first weeks May he told reporters after briefing Unlike most major U S banks whose reporting year ends on December Canadian banks operate on November through October basis At press briefing Mulholland detailed proposed debt equity conversion scheme aimed at boosting investment capital conserving foreign exchange reserves Unlike many existing programs Bank Montreal intends to sell own dollar denominated debt at par to either obligor or local investors cruzados then be ploughed into Brazilian assets Mulholland current debt equity schemes bank debt often sold to foreign third parties at discount were like peddling off debt at fire sale prices He added they could do pyschological harm to investor confidence While acknowledging Brazil yet to give official blessing to plan Mulholland predicted if supported we going to see more Sources at other large banks sizeable exposure to Brazil were so sure scheme s success I don t think s going to fly because impact on money supply other political reasons one banker noting earlier informal proposals along same lines received fairly neutral responses And there market such investment time great uncertainty he added Mulholland admitted it something experiment some one to screw up courage do something It very important avenues to reversing net capital outflows broadened he added noting recent years options fact been narrowing Another senior banker agreed debt equity swap proposals such as Bank Montreal s should be explored developed but warned Brasilia been very ambivalent debt equity schemes thus far banker added debt equity conversion should happen but major instrument solving debt problems

reuters.unknown: A RM f reute u f BC STERLING REBOUNDS ON

text.title: STERLING REBOUNDS ON LAWSON TARGET DENIAL
text.author: By Geert Linnebank Reuters
text.body: Sterling made sharp recovery when U K Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson described remarks he made yesterday on targets pound as insignificant rallying back up almost exactly to levels fetched before Lawson spoke yesterday dealers analysts They sterling likely leave limelight once again to trade quietly around current levels as markets set their sights on dollar yen mark again ahead key international monetary talks Washington next week Sterling ended European day at dlrs virtually unchanged yesterday s dlrs fetched before Lawson s first comment But well up on levels just above dlrs held until second comment came Against mark sterling recovered to close at marks after today s opening night s On balance as if nothing happened We back to where we were before Mark Brett economist at securities house Barclays de Zoete Wedd This whole story like storm teacup dealer U K Bank commented pound s recovery triggered when Lawson criticised media coverage comments he made yesterday when he told conference he wanted sterling to stay roughly where context Lawson reported to specified rates around marks dlrs to pound remarks markets were quick to interpret as signal to sell sterling Lawson today he merely stated yesterday s approximate value pound The wrong end stick picked up he told reporters adding his comments did no way signal change British exchange rate policies Dealers analysts reactions to both statements were clear evidence market frustrated by relative currency stability after February Paris agreement desperate to reactivate trading react to any clues offered contents currency accord Paris finance ministers Group Five Canada widely believed to agreed exchange rate targets although no participant specified these apparent bid to foster stability by keeping markets guessing The markets absolutely desperate to get clues on Group Six countries part to Paris agreement targets number rumours flying around bigger than ever before Barclays de Zoete Wedd s Brett Analysts neither yesterday s remarks nor today s changed their impression after Paris sterling targeted to trade broad ranges against major currencies All polled analysts if anything marks level mentioned by Lawson probably centre wide pfennig range sterling easily hold helped by good economic indicators relatively high interest rates It be insane to pinpoint exchange rate ahead election I don t believe Lawson mad enough to tie himself to fixed rate Brett He expected sterling to firm over next few weeks to around marks dlrs as overseas investors reappraised high yielding investments here Robin Marshall chief economist at Chase Manhattan Securities he surprised to see Lawson qualify his sterling target comments so quickly His remarks gave markets target to aim at he adding He Lawson talked himself into bit corner on made him hostage to fortune Marshall other analysts dismissed theory by quoting target rates Lawson attempted to put pressure on prime Minister Margaret Thatcher to agree to British membership European Monetary System EMS as implausible
