text.title: GOURMET COFFEE MAKES U S SUPERMARKET DEBUT
text.author: By Maisie McAdoo Reuters
text.body: Shoppers who buy Haagen Daas ice cream Dijon mustard or Tuborg beer on their weekly trip to supermarket soon to be target promotional blitz national brand gourmet coffees General Foods largest U S coffee roaster P shares third place U S market only two national brand roasters so far to introduce higher quality coffees into selected supermarkets But industry insiders believe there substantial growth potential upscale coffee despite years flat sales regular ground roast types I suspect General Foods make name themselves their gourmet line coffee trade source What could do really dent small store whole bean business trade source added new lines designed to appeal to classic advertising composite the yuppie consumer They buy fresh pasta subscribe to Bon Appetit magazine were first on their block wok as described by Karin Brown General Foods senior product manager new coffee called Private Collection out GF s Maxwell House division Paul Gallant president P s Compass Foods subsidiary makes new P gourmet line described potential appeal as a status thing At initial price dlrs ounces expensive though more so than high quality coffee sold small specialty stores General Foods Maxwell House Div just cut price on new offering by cents to dlrs ounces a move competitor P bound to imitate according to P executive Number two U S roaster Folgers nothing to announce at point gourmet line spokesman Neither does Hills Bros subsidiary Nestle shares third fourth size market spot by volume P Competitors believe Folgers watch progress General Foods offering prepared to jump if market takes off General Foods P hope their new products help push coffee sales out doldrums Coffee consumption United States fallen pct since according to study by International Coffee Organization Sales show no signs picking up Compass s Gallant blames falloff on declines coffee quality since s aggressive soft drink marketing The national brands began to cheapen blend name profit but spent dlrs year telling consumers quality coffee Gallant As result first time consumers never got taste brew first time young consumer tries coffee they turn around say My God awful I think I ll Coke he Having now mostly written off age group who confirmed their loyalty to soft drinks coffee marketers aiming at high income free spending self treating crowd yuppie composite Where else you going to go industry source Kids aren t going to drink coffee s apparent There no other markets only area s been promoted gourmet he addition to perking up sales success gourmet line could provide much higher margins to roasters than regular ground roast coffees produce Generally retail prices twice price green unroasted coffee beans taking into account costs roasting packaging distribution then deducting often generous trade discounts Supermarkets tend to sell coffee near trade price as loss leader product designed to draw shoppers into store But new gourmet lines different pricing structure prevails industry sources There no trade discounting emphasis on expensive packaging including special valve designed to keep beans fresher Dealers roasters were buying higher quality green beans at dlrs lb Thus retail prices on gourmet coffee now almost three times price green Targetted consumers seem willing to pay difference General Foods claims pct consumers their test market surveys Private Collection came back more product manager Brown points to success more expensive beers mustard ice cream began selling restricted high income areas now available almost every supermarket country P similarly optimistic We think we ll do extremely well gourmet market Gallant Maxwell House marketing eight types Private Collection selected high income areas while P offers different whole bean gourmet coffees called O Clock Royale only their own stores Philadelphia Baltimore New York Atlanta some other metropolitan areas

turning around on stocks whole supply demand picture could finally be getting more balance USDA analyst USDA prospective plantings report week indicated U S farmers idle to acres annual acreage reduction programs year additional acres been enrolled conservation reserve program bringing total idled acreage U S to acres almost third nation s total acre crop base Production wheat corn soybeans probably closely match annual usage limiting any buildup stocks analysts It s substantially different story year when we added billion bushels corn to stockpile Vernon McMinimy director commodity estimated total U S corn disappearance could end up at billion bushels possibly resulting million bushel reduction current corn stockpile billion bushels To say represents turn around wrong but we re at least holding pattern George Hoffman director commodity analysis Pillsbury Hoffman wheat stocks could rise slightly by end to billion bushels due to significantly less domestic feed use wheat because lower corn prices USDA analysts however project slightly higher usage wheat stocks either decrease slightly or at least increase yearly use at around two billion bushels next year s projected crop could be used up analyst We won t be adding to stocks Stocks at record now so if we can begin to touch them even minutely through acreage reductions be improvement Agriculture Department wheat text.title: JAPANESE BANKS EXPAND HONG KONG PRESENCE
text.author: By Allan Ng Reuters
text.body: At time when Britain threatening to revoke license Japanese banks retaliation restrictive trade practices Hong Kong rolling out welcome mat to Japan British colony week issued banking licence to Bank Fukuoka Ltd making th Japanese bank here Japan largest banking contingent Hong Kong followed by U S banks Eleven Japanese banks representative offices here Japanese institutions operate deposit taking companies DTCs Assistant banking commissioner K K Wong told Reuters There no special favours towards Japanese But because Japan s strong economy currency they easily meet our requirement on assets billion U S Dlrs Japanese control largest share assets financial institutions here but incorporated elsewhere billion H K Dlrs at end or pct total Hong Kong authorities welcome Japanese banks Haruo Kimura assistant general manager Bank Tokyo But U S Britain unhappy slow liberalisation Tokyo financial market Japanese bankers Hong Kong offers good business opportunities especially China trade to Japanese banks who following their clients international expansion As their clients become more international they to keep up follow them Yutaka Toda Dai Ichi Kangyo Bank s general manager here We can access to local traders regional corporations Bank Tokyo s Kimura We can also pick up business China Bankers more Japanese banks on way influx Japanese banks began late s when government lifted moratorium on new licences But newcomers allowed one branch each only Bank Tokyo Sanwa Bank Sumitomo Bank more than one branch Because limitation Japanese banks mostly concentrated on wholesale business It very difficult to compete those giants such as Hongkong Bank Bank China Kimura Bank Tokyo Bank Tokyo largest Japanese bank network here seven branches while Hongkong Shanghai Banking Corp Bank China groups each hundreds branches To broaden their client deposit base some Japanese banks taken equity local banks latest such move Dai Ichi Kangyo s increase stake Chekiang First Bank year to pct pct Tokai Bank Fuji Bank Mitsubishi Bank also interests small local banks But Mitsubishi content single branch licence pct stake small Liu Chong Hing Bank bought Mercantile Bank Ltd s multi branch licence early year We open one more branch Hong Kong s district Kowloon soon to better serve our clients on other side harbour Mitsubishi Bank general manager Takeshi Tange Their weakness retail market forces Japanese banks to rely on interbank market funding Government data show despite their large share total assets Japanese banks only billion dlrs deposits at end or pct deposits banks Hong Kong incorporated elsewhere Most Japanese banks international lendings region booked Hong Kong Japanese banker who declined to be named He mainly tax reasons adding assets such as loans booked Hong Kong subject to Japanese tax Japanese banks barred by Tokyo government issuing Eurobonds but their Hong Kong subsidiaries can tap Euromarket lend funds to parent Bankers role could be undermined by five pct capital adequacy ratio goes into effect next year requiring many DTC s to increase their capital Many Japanese banks seeking special treatment their largely offshore operations or different risk calculation their assets I don t think stop them coming here banker But may mean they to conduct some their offshore funding operations elsewhere

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC CHINA CURTAILS KEY RE

text.title: CHINA CURTAILS KEY REFORM GOAL OF REALISTIC PRICES
text.author: By Mark O Neill Reuters
text.body: Fear social instability inflation forced China to curtail major economic reform overhauling pricing system prices bear no relation to production costs Despite pledges year price changes were needed to get economy on right track Peking repeatedly no major change happen year backtracking occurred during conservative backlash following resignation January reformist Communist Party leader Hu Yaobang western diplomats Chinese sources say Price changes two years aroused great public discontent especially cities one western diplomat Chinese were used to stable prices years when communists took over On recent visit to two major cities refrain all officials need to preserve social stability Chinese journalist reformers under estimated potential public resistance to price increases A major review all economic reforms under way biggest since reforms began because many things going well large budget deficit too rapid price increases no major improvement productivity state firms Chinese journalist view reflected by official People s Daily major article week daily price increases been taking place too quickly recent years In future price changes should be only small steps adding wage increases lax monetary policies resulted too much money chasing too few goods Chinese journalist review part due to political factors Economics politics inseparable China But western media wrong to classify leadership into reformers conservatives All leaders agree on main direction economic reform open door he But there differences opinion on pace reform on specific policies No one advocating return to how things were before Those who say prices should reflect production costs believe issue vital to China s economy Sugar example official newspaper earlier year over pct country s sugar mills were losing money or closed because price sugar changed years while production costs risen sharply over same period western diplomat Chinese leaders did fear backlash against rising prices result rioting streets they means to control The bottom line how such protests be used by those power struggle inside Communist Party he foreign lawyer referring to crisis sparked by student demonstrations led to Hu s replacement The leadership here self perpetuating oligarchy There no way going to give up power Chinese journalist added China appears to reached crossroads There no clear proposal as to what to do next he Premier Zhao Ziyang instructed his think tanks to come up how to continue reforms But time being at least path leading to price reforms out favour

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC REAGAN S STRENGTH IN

text.title: REAGAN S STRENGTH IN U S CONGRESS APPEARS SAPPED
text.author: By Michael Gelb Reuters
text.body: President Reagan s reduced strength Congress been demonstrated by U S Senate s decision to approve highway spending bill despite his attempts to veto political analysts He s very weakened William Schneider private American Enterprise public policy group after Senate voted yesterday to ignore Reagan s veto road bill Schneider contrasted Reagan s failure his previous ability to win clear majorities on major issues Sustaining his veto required him to win just one third votes either house Congress third consecutive fight over presidential veto on Congress defied Reagan whose clout legislature been greatly diminished by arms for Iran scandal capture majority Senate by opposition Democratic party November election Congress overrode Reagan s veto popular water projects bill January autumn Congress rejected his veto economic sanctions against South Africa But time president laid his full authority on line even making rare journey to Capitol Hill to plead support person both House Senate Democratic hands analysts say Reagan swiftly becoming lame duck facing difficulties enacting his own legislative agenda especially given furore over Iran arms deal situation contrasts Reagan s first six years office when Republican controlled Senate backing conservative Democrats House enabled Reagan to win passage most his legislative priorities Reagan s ability to veto legislation he dislikes been his strongest weapon dealing Congress but his defeat on highway bill expected to reduce credibility his veto power Senator John Chafee Rhode Island Republican told New York Times earlier week if Reagan lost there be no brake on if you suggest presidential veto you be laughed away Yesterday s defeat came two days after House Representatives overwhelming rejection presidential veto on highways bill by votes to White House strategists presented veto fight as test Reagan s strength as he attempted to recover scandal over secret arms sales to Iran Senate Republican leader Robert Dole Kansas pleaded fellow party members to back Reagan because this may determine strength presidency next months defeat showed problems facing any president his final years office Reagan s term expires January majority Republicans House Representatives Senate apparently decided their own political concerns become more important than president s President Reagan he ain t going to be running but I am Congressman Arthur Ravenel South Carolina Republican on Tuesday his decision to back bill means money jobs his home district new highway construction defeat interrupted good streak Reagan who won applause his selection February former Senate majority leader Howard Baker to replace Donald Regan as White House chief staff believed by most political analysts to benefitted televised speech news conference on Iran affair month steady drop Reagan s job approval ratings appeared to level off recent weeks president slumped pct autumn to pct after Tower Commission report February he failed to exercise proper control over dealings Iran His approval rating hovers at pct Reagan he deeply disappointed by Senate defeat but my efforts to control spending diminished Democratic leader Robert Byrd this isn t going to make or break president

reuters.unknown: A f reute u f BC U S TREASURY POLICIE

text.title: U S TREASURY POLICIES SAID UNCHANGED BY DEPARTURE
text.author: By Peter Torday
text.body: The departure James Baker s closest aide Deputy Treasury Secretary Richard Darman change course Washington s domestic international economic policies U S officials Darman who worked alongside Baker six years widely credited helping him mastermind initiatives on currency management international economic cooperation U S Officials Darman also played key role shepherding President Reagan s sweeping tax reform plan through U S Congress But they flatly dismissed suggestions his departure to investment banking firm Shearson Lehman Brothers signaled Baker team breaking up or Treasury Secretary himself might leave soon It really does mean he took opportunity as came up one official Another commented Baker miss him but he s going to stand his way There been widespread speculation since autumn Darman sought Wall Street job Officials Darman felt passage tax reform late year marked appropriate moment to bow out Baker acknowledged Darman be sorely missed Dick Darman contributed mightily to success administration over past six years his departure represents substantial loss he U S Officials admitted Darman s absence be undoubted blow to Baker who relied on him policy advice both at White House Reagan s second term at Treasury One aide once described Darman as indispensable to Baker Baker widely thought to want more stable currency system Darman generally credited by officials other nations as Baker s leading theorist on issue favouring target zones to limit currency fluctuations Earlier year monetary sources U S Treasury unsuccessfully sounded out allies on target zone system But U S Official disputed assessment Darman gone Baker abandon international initiatives Baker s work as head Reagan s Economic Policy Council spearheading trade policy his skills negotiating Democrat controlled Congress go on as before Darman s strength as economist but as political strategist and s Baker s strength too official There were already indications Baker who throughout his time government relied on closely knit circle advisers moved swiftly to find successor One possibility Baker might turn to George Gould who holds number three Treasury position Under Secretary Gould another close confidante known Baker years Before joining Treasury November Gould partner at Wall Steet firm Wertheim Co formerly headed Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette Securities Corp Darman announcement came on eve semi annual meetings International Monetary Fund World Bank where many policies Darman helped shape be debated He helped Baker devise September Plaza Agreement when United States Japan West Germany France Britain curbed dollar s strength pact major turning point U S Policy ending period disdain economic cooperation intervention currency markets Darman also worked on some other Baker initiatives like Tokyo Summit agreement to intensify coordination economic policies among leading industrial countries recent Paris Agreement to stabilise currencies stimulate global growth These policies collectively aimed at redressing huge gap between Japan West Germany s trade surpluses United State s massive trade deficit policy goal still remains prime objective Reagan Administration change Darman s departure

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC EC MINISTERS WILL DIS

text.title: EC MINISTERS WILL DISCUSS STRENGTHENING EMS FLOAT
text.author: By Tony Carritt Reuters
text.body: European Community finance ministers central bankers meet Belgium weekend to discuss strengthening Europe s joint currency float amid continuing worries turbulence on foreign exchanges Belgian Finance Minister Mark Eyskens who host informal talks told Reuters ministers central bank chiefs discuss situation on currency markets light February agreement among leading industrialised countries to stabilise exchange rates around present levels interview Eyskens he felt Paris accord between United States Japan West Germany France Britain Canada proved itself more or less workable But doubts over effectiveness durability been growing since fears trade war between United States Japan over computer microchips pushed dollar to record low against surging yen early week talks at Belgian resort Knokke being held to coordinate EC s positions on monetary issues Third World debt ahead Spring meetings International Monetary Fund World Bank Washington next week EC gathering begins tonight dinner but main discussions take place tomorrow Continued international currency turbulence could undermine plans reinforcing European Monetary System joint float holding eight EC currencies within narrow fluctuation bands feature high on weekend agenda Eyskens repeatedly Europe needs period calm on world currency markets particular more stable dollar before can set strengthening EMS to make more resilient against exchange rate swings EMS been taking battering over year as falling dollar sent funds surging into dominant EMS currency West German mark forcing ministers to undertake two major realignments parities within nine months interview Eyskens made clear he hoping wide ranging discussion on future eight year old EMS on basis proposals bolstering drawn up by EC s Monetary Committee Committee Central Bank Governors committees were asked to come up proposals after reshuffle EMS exchange rates January Eyskens repeated calls European Currency Unit fledgling EC currency at core system to take over mark s dominant role EMS proposal met cool response West Germany He EC Commission President Jacques Delors report to meeting on problems raised by plans to liberalise capital movements fully within nation bloc by such as need harmonising taxes banking controls Eyskens liberalisation capital movements without strengthening EMS be element destabilisation Community He crucial issue debate whether member states were willing to push further towards EC s goal monetary integration on basis EMS included management exchange rates by some kind common institution instead by national central banks as at present Plans creation such institution foreseen by EMS s founding fathers been thwarted by reluctance some countries notably West Germany to gove up their sovereignty monetary field EMS development also been held up by Britain s refusal so far to join system s core exchange rate mechanism

strong defenses easily deter any suitor one those being problems combining two railroad properties hang regulatory limbo Richard Fischer Merrill Lynch Co Inc Santa Fe at December dlrs cash cash equivalents while long term debt to capital just over pct This gives them plenty borrowing power he could be used against unwanted suitor Henley Group s Chairman Michael Dingman he wants to take major positions undervalued natural resource companies He also told Reuters interview he seeking acquisition two billion to eight billion dlrs Santa Fe officials don t appear concerned Henley might launch takeover I characterize atmosphere around here as one concern one Santa Fe executive Henley I think s wrong to assume Dingman formed firm strategy Santa Fe Mark Hassenberg who covers Henley DLJ foreseeable future These realities they support Henley Group s statement Santa Fe stake only investment more pressing problem facing Santa Fe overcoming difficulties merging two railroads Atchison Topeka Santa Fe Railway Co Southern Pacific Transportation Co merger create nation s second longest railroad July Interstate Commerce Commission ICC denied merger on anticompetitive grounds company since granted trackage sharing rights to four western railroads to meet ICC s concerns persuade to reopen hearings three year old struggle to merge lines My guess commission decide three to six weeks Voytko at Paine Webber believes Santa Fe could fight off Henley Group cash credit Citing share buybacks Norfolk Southern he one Santa Fe s options if threatened could be to buy Henley stake It indeed possible Dingman sees as low risk opportunistic investment Voytko People who follow Santa Fe given me values dlrs to dlrs share DLJ Securities Hassenberg But I m certain Dingman s mind company worth more than breakup value

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC IMF WORLD BANK TO ME

text.title: IMF WORLD BANK TO MEET AMID NEW INFLATION FEARS
text.author: By Alver Carlson Reuters
text.body: Amid new concerns inflation interest rate increases trade confrontations finance ministers central bankers meet next week to discuss deteriorating global debt economic situation meetings under auspices International Monetary Fund World Bank come as interest rates turning higher already weak dollar sunk further upsetting bond stock markets Uncertainty growing vitality global economy whether heavily indebted countries can continue to carry burden their growing debt without vast new assistance Monetary diplomatic sources there no signs any new debt initiative sort Treasury Secretary James Baker unveiled months ago Seoul works strategy drawn serious challenge Brazil suspended interest payments on billion dlrs commercial bank debt month Banks responded by laying groundwork writing down Brazilian loans Separately French Prime Minister Jacques Chirac visit earlier week President Reagan sounded out administration on plan to funnel worldwide grain surpluses to very poorest states French plan certain to be discussed by ministers detail during next week s meetings undoubtedly be embraced by developing countries There s interest on part some countries looking at support special problems very poorest countries because their position so extreme Reagan administration official He suggested Washington open to disussing issue meetings also assess success Baker debt initiative called new funding to help debtor countries grow out their problems largest industrial countries been attempting to coordinate economic policy hope controlling decline dollar U S trade budget deficits other problems At same time industrial countries see little evidence strengthening economic activity Fund forecasts they grow pct United States sees pct growth itself continuing expansion fifth year asked other industrial countries to stimulate their economies These issues directly affect debt problem ability debtor countries to grow out their difficulties recent years U S markets absorbed exports developing country allowing them to earn critical foreign exchange But United States wants to cut trade deficit running at record billion dlrs pressing others to import more developing countries discussions April six to be wide ranging touching everything interest rates to impact development loans on environment according to monetary sources talks include examination trade protectionist pressures wake decision by Reagan administration to place some dlrs tariffs on microchip products Japan sources move accelerated dollar s decline as financial markets grew alarmed trade war offing There concern action prompted by U S charges Japan been selling computer chip products below fair market value kept own market closed to imports further undermining international trading system At same time ministers discuss fundamental price weakness basic commodities export mainstay many developing countries so called Group Five industrial countries United States Japan West Germany France Britain gather first time since their February talks Paris where they agreed to keep dollar sliding further Five be joined later by Italy Canada further debate on economic policy coordination As part Paris accord surplus countries such as Japan agreed to stimulate their economies while America reduce federal budget deficit Other major issues meetings include U S bid to to larger say approving loans Inter American Development Bank strengthening link between loans economic policy changes debtor nations Washington also pressing World Bank to take more account environment when making loan dams other projects new head Bank Barber Conable issue being reviewed be part reorganization plan Bank now being prepared

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT TOKYO HARD ON FOREIGN TRADERS
text.author: By Steven Brull Reuters
text.body: Overseas securities firms spending millions dollars to set up operations Tokyo but many end up losing money industry sources banks securities firms eager to establish themselves as international players building presence Japan become imperative Thirty six already licensed to trade securities on Tokyo Stock Exchange world s second largest More than expected by year end But as deregulation erodes brokers profits global share buying spree predicted to subside only those securities traders first class financial muscle survive sources There be foreigners fallout They come here too glib ideas how they can survive David Miller director general manager Jardine Fleming Securities Ltd s Tokyo branch Despite soaring share prices sharp falls commissions on stock transactions hurt even brokerages came to Tokyo early Japanese equities no longer very profitable business margins nothing like they were two or three years ago Things as rosy as they may seem Miller Publicly reported earnings foreign securities houses Japan half year ended September showed Salomon Brothers Asia Ltd on top profits billion yen Most other firms reported hefty gains over year before But industry sources say figures do fully reveal costs running international brokerage world s most expensive city Salary packages free housing novice analysts routinely run more than dlrs year Miller whose firm earnings billion yen half year to September costs operation strong enough to endure to dlrs year I d be surprised if more than two or three were making money if they honestly accounted their costs he To bring commissions closer to world rates Finance Ministry slashed fixed brokerage fees year especially on large lot deals few years all rates may be negotiated as they New York London industry sources Since October s Big Bang deregulation London s financial markets at least half equity trading deals there generated no commission income at all Stockbroking firms unlikely to make money until some forced out business analysts first foreign firms to set up here especially six admitted as members February advantage over latecomers they six Merrill Lynch Japan Inc Goldman Sachs International Corp Morgan Stanley International Inc Vickers Da Costa Ltd Jardine Fleming Securities Ltd S G Warburg Co Japan Ltd memberships cost five dlrs allow firms to execute their own trades unlike houses branch status avoid paying away pct their commissions to member firms place trades Members can also communicate instantly exchange floor vital source information market tends to follow leader Sources seven to more seats on exchange likely to open up sometime non member firms wrestling away market share tenacious Japanese foreign firms costly intangibles sometimes prove even more important than exchange membership Your name better known if you re member right club Miller It s easier to hire New people To inaugurate Japan operation SBCI Securities Asia Ltd flew out Basel Ballet January receptions Tokyo Osaka firm pct owned by Swiss Bank Corp gave guests gifts Swiss chocolates Swatch watches It s expensive but party like token serious way we regard our development Tokyo SBCI s Tokyo branch manager Gregory Shenkman To establish position quickly SBCI hired strong research unit W I Carr Overseas Ltd s Tokyo office I very lucky Shenkman I anticipating considerable struggle to organically develop research team I am particularly optimistic prospects Japanese equity market continental European banks who little experience equities outside their domestic equity market he But prospect closing down operations may be worse One be ill advised to open here close then decide to open again two or three years later I m sure Japansese community respond well to sort attitude he

reuters.unknown: G T M C f reute r f PM CHINA PRICES NEWS ANALYSIS

text.title: CHINA PUTS BRAKE ON KEY REFORM GOAL
text.author: By Mark O Neill
text.body: Fear social instability inflation forced China to put brakes on one most important economic reforms overhauling pricing system often bears no relation to production costs price clampdown occurred during conservative backlash following resignation January reformist Communist Party leader Hu Yaobang Western diplomats Chinese sources say In recent years prices only been rising but rate increase getting faster faster People s Daily major article week In future price changes should be only small steps Despite pledges year price changes were essential to get economy on right track government repeatedly no major change happen year Price changes two years aroused great public discontent especially cities Western diplomat Chinese were used to stable prices years when Communists took over On recent visit to two major cities refrain all officials need to preserve social stability he Chinese journalist reformers underestimated extent to public tolerate price changes A major review all economic reforms under way biggest since reforms began because many things going well large budget deficit too rapid price increases no major improvement productivity state firms he reformers think vital to change system under prices often bear no relation to production costs Sugar example official newspaper earlier year more than pct China s sugar mills were losing money or closed because producing sugar so unprofitable because selling price sugar changed years while mills production costs risen sharply over period economic masterplan period published April year China work steadily to establish pricing system better reflects value relation between supply demand People s Daily recent years wage increases been too high too much currency printed resulting too much money chasing too few goods causing price hikes inflation review reforms coincides national campaign against bourgeois liberalism meaning Western political ideas blamed causing student protests December journalist review part due to political factors Economics politics inseparable China But Western media wrong to classify leadership into reformers conservatives All leaders agree on main direction economic reform open door he But there differences opinion on pace reform on specific policies No one advocating return to how things were before diplomat what China feared as backlash against price rises so much rioting streets he means to control The bottom line how such protests be used by those power struggle foreign lawyer he believed cause crisis earlier year Communist Party leadership feared due to student demonstrations losing control The leadership here self perpetuating oligarchy There no way going to give up power he

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT EFTA FEARS EC MARKET PLANS
text.author: By Donald Nordberg
text.body: The European Community wants to eliminate all obstacles to free movement goods services people by laudable goal sent shivers down spines closest trading neighbours Europe s outsiders six members European Free Trade Association EFTA other small states fear growing power EC member countries market people one half times as big as whole U S as Community celebrates th anniversary non EC countries Ankara to Oslo attitude emerging says If you can t beat them join them June Community adopted plan to create internal market without restrictions included new goals on everything tourism to rules bank accounting plan so extensive even EFTA countries Switzerland Austria Sweden Norway Finland Iceland decades close trade ties find hard to adopt joint position month Turkey formally requested EC membership receiving polite reply Brussels time ripe Austria where charter neutrality forbids joining political alliances government looking ways to become de facto EC member Norway where membership rejected referendum government officials wondering whether political climate changed But nowhere debate been more existential than Switzerland resisted all alliances years Swiss microcosm Europe living geographically very heart Europe speaking languages three big economies Germany France Italy Swiss neutrality kept country out United Nations International Monetary Fund seem to preclude membership Community given EC s loose link Western defence alliance NATO But opinion poll late year held French speaking part country showed majority favoured joining Community Since then government officials stressed while membership impossible Switzerland should do everything possible to be locked out when trade barriers inside EC come down State secretary foreign trade Franz Blankart inconceivable whole Swiss nation including more conservative German speaking majority vote membership But Switzerland must be more than just satellite he now enlarged Community extending itself into areas omitted by founding Treaty Rome These areas including pharmaceutical research technological development key to economic future Switzerland Community alike he adds We cannot permit ourselves luxury passively following Community s new dynamic integration he says Swiss economy ministry drawn up detailed analysis EC White Paper on internal market outlining Swiss response to each point While some refer to collective EFTA stance officials admit on many issues Switzerland may act alone new EC plans on transport example severe impact on Switzerland Austria whose roads carry most traffic between Italy EC partners But rules such as volume petrol buses allowed to carry across border much less importance to Sweden or Finland Switzerland wants to work out ways to help people crossing borders West Germany France Italy But afraid liberal border controls Denmark EC member non EC Nordic countries might pose threat to security pin fields banking insurance very lifeblood Switzerland s service sector Swiss interests could prove directly opposite to EFTA partners their pppppppnarrow tightly protected financial markets biggest danger ahead EFTA members be their divided interests might leave EC free to set whatever guidelines standards wanted force them on other European states wanted to trade

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ITALY SETS BANK CAPIT

text.title: ITALY SETS BANK CAPITAL ADEQUACY REQUIREMENTS
text.body: The Bank Italy issued details new bank capital adequacy requirements due to come into force June central bank circular Bank Italy circular follows interministerial committee decision December to introduce minimum capital adequacy requirements banks requirements formalise criteria already use comprise risk asset ratio applicable to banking operations including foreign branches gearing ratio excludes business foreign branches risk asset ratio measures solvency defined as bank s ability to meet all liabilities through realisation assets while second establishes minimum capital bank must hold relative to size Specifically total credits off balance sheet items domestic foreign branches must exceed amount equivalent to times bank s capital net stakes held Italian banks gearing ratio limits total financial assets domestic branches to times capital net stakes held Italian banks Bank Italy requirements corresponded to risk asset ratio eight pct gearing ratio pct both ratios value equity investments stakes other than those Italian banks be deducted capital multiple total credit risk individual bank be calcluated by assigning specific weights to various categories financial assets off balance sheet assets weighting be based essentially on credit risk take into account guarantees other forms risk transfer or potential losses linked to exchange or interest rates definition capital on ratios be calculated comprises shareholders equity disclosed legal reserves plus general provisions having character reserves Own shares held portfolio be excluded Bank Italy set more stringent individual ratios those banks running greater risks regarding items such as quality mobility concentration assets to liquidity management adequacy new ratios be applied to all banks operating Italy Banks line requirements by June must correct their position shortest time possible Bank Italy transition period be allowed but be more than four years Italian branches foreign banks be exempted risk ratio when parent banks already subject to similar ratios but must comply gearing ratio Bank Italy introduction capital ratios aimed to further enhance capital adequacy at time increasing competitiveness further step bringing Italy into line supervisory norms other countries

reuters.unknown: A f reute r f BC UK HOPES HOWARD S TOK

text.title: UK HOPES HOWARD S TOKYO TRIP WILL EASE TENSIONS
text.author: By Sten Stovall Reuter
text.body: Britain Japan remained deadlocked today over trade policies political sources U K Government pinning hopes breakthrough on trip to Tokyo next week by Corporate Affairs Minister Michael Howard Howard told Reuters he try to promote understanding on trade issues during his trip starts tomorrow Meanwhile Britain re examine letter Japan s prime minister promising his personal help solution to row over U K Firm s bid to win significant role Japan s liberalised telecommunications market government sources Tensions risen following decision by Britain to arm itself early new text.title: FAA FEARS CRACKS ON OLDER MCDONNELL MD JUMBOS
text.body: The Federal Aviation Administration ordered U S airlines to inspect their older DC jumbo jets within five days hairline cracks tail areas FAA action follows warning to airlines by plane s maker Douglas Aircraft Co three cracks been discovered on two DC s Douglas Aircraft unit McDonnell Douglas Corp Such cracks typically caused by metal fatigue pose no safety risk if repaired cracks were found metal skin covering tail during aircraft maintenance If detected repaired cracks may progress until spar cap or skin panel severed could result structural failure FAA order spar cap top part tail wings main beam FAA inspection order apply to airplanes over hours flight or more than landings

text.title: VW PLANS MAJOR NEW PLANT IN CHINA
text.body: Volkswagen AG VOWG F VW plans to construct major new car plant China company spokesman However he added discussions China plant were still at early stage annual capacity up to vehicles but be built until s at earliest VW already large joint venture Chinese authorities under produces Santana model Shanghai spokesman Shanghai plant should annual capacity cars by end next year So far Santanas been produced since output began VW spokesman no decision yet been made type car could be built at new plant However company officials VW plans to bring out cheaper car than Santana Chinese market be aimed at private owners Santana generally used by government officials visiting foreigners or as taxis tourists No details were given extent investment new plant clear where be built
